intro: Pedicularis chamissonis var. japonica, commonly known as the Japanese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred shape that aids in pollination by insects. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and its ability to form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
